alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 11:12AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Central Shenandoah Valley and Potomac Highlands of Virginia as well as portions of the Potomac Highlands in eastern West Virginia, including the following areas: in Virginia, Albemarle, Augusta, Central Virginia Blue Ridge, Eastern Highland, Nelson, Rockingham and Western Highland. In eastern West Virginia, Eastern Pendleton and Western Pendleton. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and scattered thunderstorms will develop along a stalled boundary this afternoon and evening. Average rainfall amounts will be around one-half to one inch, but heavy rainfall from thunderstorms will cause localized amounts around 1 to 3 inches. Most of that heavy rain may fall in a one to three hour period, causing the potential for rapid rises of streams and creeks as well as the potential for flash flooding in urban areas. - Visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Western Highland
